Justification:

While it may seem counterintuitive, Christianity has a long history of producing successful leaders and innovators. From the early Church Fathers to modern-day CEOs, Christians have been taught to prioritize humility, discipline, and hard work. These values are essential for success in any field, and many Christians have gone on to achieve great things in business, politics, and other areas.

Furthermore, Christianity's emphasis on personal salvation and spiritual growth means that Christians are often more focused on their own development than on seeking power or wealth. This can make them more likely to be promotable, as they are less likely to get in the way of others who are trying to advance.

In short, while other religions may have produced their share of successful leaders, Christianity has a proven track record of producing promotable employees.
